# Egregore
> Egregore is a shared intelligence layer for organizations using Claude Code. It gives teams persistent memory, async handoffs, and accumulated knowledge across sessions and people.

## Docs
- [Overview](https://egregore.xyz/docs#overview): Egregore is a shared intelligence layer for organizations using Claude Code.
- [Installation](https://egregore.xyz/docs#installation): Egregore is installed via a single terminal command.
- [First Session](https://egregore.xyz/docs#first-session): Open a new terminal and type egregore.
- [/activity](https://egregore.xyz/docs#activity): See what happened since your last session.
- [/save](https://egregore.xyz/docs#save): Checkpoint your contributions.
- [/handoff](https://egregore.xyz/docs#handoff): End a session with a summary for the next person.
- [/reflect](https://egregore.xyz/docs#reflect): Capture insights from your work.
- [/add](https://egregore.xyz/docs#add): Ingest an artifact with minimal friction.
- [/note](https://egregore.xyz/docs#note): Save a personal note.
- [/ask](https://egregore.xyz/docs#ask): Ask questions — to yourself, the org, or a specific person.
- [/quest](https://egregore.xyz/docs#quest): Manage quests — open-ended explorations that anyone can contribute to.
- [/todo](https://egregore.xyz/docs#todo): Manage personal todos — lightweight intent capture that flows into quests, asks, and activity.
- [/project](https://egregore.xyz/docs#project): Show project status — linked quests, recent artifacts, and entry points.
- [/invite](https://egregore.xyz/docs#invite): Invite someone to your Egregore.
- [/meeting](https://egregore.xyz/docs#meeting): Ingest meeting knowledge from Granola.
- [Shared Memory](https://egregore.xyz/docs#memory): Memory is a Git repository shared by all team members.
- [Knowledge Graph](https://egregore.xyz/docs#graph): Neo4j is the query layer over shared memory.
- [Hooks](https://egregore.xyz/docs#hooks): Hooks are shell commands that execute automatically in response to Claude Code events.
- [Git Workflow](https://egregore.xyz/docs#git-workflow): Egregore handles all git operations behind the scenes.
- [egregore.json](https://egregore.xyz/docs#egregore-json): The main configuration file.
- [.env](https://egregore.xyz/docs#env-file): Personal secrets file.
- [/update](https://egregore.xyz/docs#update): Update your local Egregore environment.
- [/tutorial](https://egregore.xyz/docs#tutorial): Interactive walkthrough of Egregore’s core loop.
